definition:
A functor $T:\mathcal{C}\to\mathcal{D}$ is *full* if the *arrow
function* of $T$ is surjective for every pair of objects in
$\mathcal{C}$. More precisely, for every pair
$C_1, C_2\in \operatorname{Ob}(\mathcal{C})$, the arrow function
$T_{(C_1,C_2)}$ of $T:$
$$T_{(C_1,C_2)}:\operatorname{hom_{\mathcal{C}}}(C_1,C_2)\to\operatorname{hom_{\mathcal{D}}}(T(C_1),T(C_2))$$
given by $T_{(C_1,C_2)}(f)=T(f)$ is a surjection.
